lead_paragraph: OGDEN--Elliott M.,Jr., died peacefully at his home in Manhattan on April 9, 2016 . He was 95 years old. Elliott is survived by his wife of 53 years, Mary S. Ogden, and by five sons, Elliott M. Ogden III of Armonk, NY; Thomas P. Ogden of New York, NY; Gordon S. Ogden of New York, NY; Henry M. Ogden II of Boca Raton, FL; and Jacob B. Ogden of Wainscott, NY. Seven grandchildren also survive him. His son George deG. Ogden and his eldest grandson, Elliott M. Ogden IV, predeceased him. Elliott was born on January 11, 1921 in Milwaukee, WI to Elliott M. Ogden and Hedwig Ogden. He attended the Milwaukee Country Day School and graduated from Princeton University, Class of 1944. During World War II, he served in the Army Air Corps and was stationed in England and Normandy. Elliott founded Elliott Ogden Company, an advertising concern, in New York in the 1950s. In the late 1960s, he became editor and publisher of Manhattan East, a neighborhood weekly. In the 1980s, he founded Ogden Properties Group, a private real estate investment company. For over 40 years, Elliott and Mary maintained a home in the Georgica Association in Wainscott, NY. For several years, he served as President of the Association, and as President of the Bridgehampton Day Care Center. Elliott loved the ocean and beach, and was an avid swimmer as well as an occasional golfer and tennis player. He was a member of the Princeton Club of New York, one of the longest-tenured members of the Racquet and Tennis Club in Manhattan and served on the board of the Collegiate School. Elliott will be remembered for his quick wit, and his kindness and words of wisdom for all. His positive attitude was legendary: "No problems kid, just solutions." He will be sorely missed as a generous and loving husband, father, grandfather, and friend. A Memorial Service will be held at 2pm on Tuesday, May 3 at the Brick Presbyterian Church, 91st Street and Park Avenue. 1/3
